title.narrative: Skills and Attitude (S&A), Governance and Anti-corruption (G&A), Covid19 Response (C19)

description.narrative: The intervention is part of a larger EU program called “Inclusive Green Economy Uptake Programme (GreenUP)”, which contributes to the Ugandan transition toward an inclusive, green and competitive low-carbon economy with the creation of decent green jobs in a number of key sectors, as laid down in the Uganda Green Growth Development Strategy (UGGDS), with the following 3 priority areas: Priority Area 1: Support to Uganda's Business Environment ; P.A 2: Support to Uganda's Broader Investment climate ; P.A 3: Value-chain Development. The different components of this programme will be implemented by several partners (Enabel, PSFU, FSDA, FAO, etc.) through various implementation modalities. As far as the Business Environment Component of the Green Up Programme is concerned, the EU-delegation in Uganda chose to implement two components, namely Skills and Attitude (S&A) and Governance and Anti-Corruption (G&C) in indirect management with a member state organization (Enabel) with longstanding experience in these sectors and fields, as well as a positive and established track record of relations with the main stakeholders.
